content.question: The motion of an object undergoing simple harmonic motion is found to obey the differential equation <math alttext="the second derivative of x, with respect to t, equals negative 4 x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> where <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the object’s displacement in meters and <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the time in seconds. The frequency of oscillation for the object is

choices.label: <math alttext="1 over pi, hertz" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mtext> Hz</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="2 over pi, hertz" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mtext> Hz</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="4 over pi, hertz" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mtext> Hz</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="8 over pi, hertz" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mtext> Hz</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="16 over pi, hertz" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mtext> Hz</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1 over pi, hertz" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mtext> Hz</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
